The record of animals on hand was not up to date. The licensee reports she has not updated the record for approximately
1 month and the disparity between the total number of animals on hand versus on record was about 33%. It is important
to keep an accurate record of animals on hand in case of emergency or escape, and for trace back purposes. Correct by
updating and maintaining an updated list of animals on hand by Feb 2, 2023.

There is no documented Contingency Plan in place. Failure to develop and document a Contingency Plan could result in
a delayed response to emergencies and injury or loss of animal life, property, or business. Dealers must develop,
document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing, and
care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. Correct by developing and documenting a contingency
plan by Feb 2, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
